com.wx.action.command

Class Command

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wx.action.command.Command

  • public class Command
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a representation of a command. A typical line command is built in two parts, first the Command name and an undefined number of parameters (all separated by spaces). If the input contains no command name, it will be interpreted as an action command that can be identified by using isActionCommand() or by comparing getName().equals(ACTION_CMD)

    A command can be chained with others.
    See Also:
    CommandBuilder

        public boolean isActionCommand()
        Determine if this is an action command (ie. if this command has no name nor parameters, the user's input is just a blank line).
        Returns:

      • splitParam

        public Command splitParam(int index,
                          java.lang.String regex)
        Split a parameter into a sublist of parameters according to the given regular expression. All the new parameters will be inserted from the same position (shifting all the next parameters further).
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the parameter to split
        regex - Regular expression to use (see String.split(String))
        Returns:
        A new Command with the parameters split
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index is out of bounds

      • splitParam

        public Command splitParam(int index,
                          java.lang.String regex,
                          int expected)
        Split a parameter into a sublist of parameters according to the given regular expression. All the new parameters will be inserted from the same position (shifting all the next parameters further).

        If the number of newly created parameters does not match to the expected number, then an input exception is thrown.

        Parameters:
        index - Index of the parameter to split
        regex - Regular expression to use (see String.split(String))
        expected - Expected number of new parameters
        Returns:
        A new Command with the parameters split as expected
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index is out of bounds or if the number of newly created parameters does not match the expected number.

      • getOption

        public java.lang.String getOption(java.lang.String... optionId)
        Search an option (any of the given) an return its parameter. If the option does not exist, this method returns null. If the option does exist but is not followed by any parameter, an exception is thrown.

        Here is an example of use: 
         
 cmd -p param
        Where the option is -p and the returned parameter is param.
        Parameters:
        optionId - Any of the identifiers of the option to find
        Returns:
        The option's parameter or null if the option does not exist
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the option's parameter is missing

      • getOptions

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getOptions(int max,
                                                   java.lang.String... markers)

      • hasNext

        public boolean hasNext()
        Tells if another command has been buffered within this one. This can happen if the user inputs multiple commands at the same time using the command separator.
        Returns:
        true if it has a next command

      • getNext

        public Command getNext()
        Returns the next command buffered within this one or null if it has not such command. A next command can exist if the user inputs multiple commands at the same time using the command separator.
        Returns:
        The next command or null if it hasn't one
